aQLBjjeL8RPSAh91bq72-g.text: Visited twice on this trip. Croissants are light and buttery, the scones are delicious and the coffee is excellent. I only wish we had time to try the sandwiches and the baguettes. Sweet little place I highly recommend.

0o-WHaBP9sUXZ9FqqNOBEQ.text: We stopped by this little cafe today for a quick bite before the castle. I had Le Parisienne sandwich with jambon blanco.  Their baguettes made on premise are much nicer than an average cafe sandwich baguette, with a crusty outside and light & soft inside.  The cheese and ham were both good in quality.    They have sandwiches that specify mayo on the menu, of which I opted not to choose.  My sandwich came, and it was de-lish. Simple, quality ingredients.  Onto the second half..a pocket-ful of mayo! A bit taken back, as I am not a fan of mayo.  But I never say never..if done right, I can let it go.  This was the case this time, I didn't mind it so much, and enjoyed the rest of the sandwich.   A nice place to pop on by for a quickie bite, with peace and no-pressure friendly french fare.  Nice casual, simple, good.  I was hungry and left content :)   Merci~ prob will be back again

xLM6YuFdsMH44z_3nLTyZA.text: Great croissants! Scones are on point.  Cute French bakery. We would go and get take away to bring back to our Airbandb. I only wish they were open earlier in the morning.  I highly recommend.

IHElaZ02mowns_br79nMDw.text: Adorable French bakery with sandwiches, quiche, fresh-baked bread, macaroons, cakes and pastries. The croissants are fabulous and exactly how they make them in France: light, flaky on the outside and buttery and chewy on the inside. The Assam breakfast tea I had was malty and comforting, and my boyfriend's flat white was good. We had a salmon and cream cheese baguette sandwich and quiche Lorraine, both of which were flavorful and satisfying. We'll likely be back this trip!

photos.caption: Photo of La Barantine Victoria - Edinburgh, United Kingdom. The front of the cafe.
Photo of La Barantine Victoria - Edinburgh, United Kingdom. The croissants are fabulius: light, flaky and buttery.
Photo of La Barantine Victoria - Edinburgh, United Kingdom. Assam breakfast tea.

LU5a2QfCfkRlWz6boOHEmQ.text: This is a great little (and I emphasize little) French bakery for coffee, croissants and pastries! A little oasis for Francophiles in Edinburgh we enjoyed our breakfast time there. Be patient because it can be busy and crowded but those that wait are amply rewarded.

4o3f6vs8urt37geHnM4Ymw.text: Nice little French bakery. We had the scrambled egg and spinach on toast with smoked salmon plus salad. The egg and spinach on toast was well seasoned, although wish there was slightly more salmon on top (I'm always greedy with salmon). Then we finished the meal with tartare citron and fruit tartlette framboise. The former could have been more Lemony but that's just my taste.   All in all a nice place for a brilliant continental breakfast

yOjW_i0xLzPgIin5TsGvpA.text: Best croissant yet, lovely spot, good espresso & latte. Haven't sampled the food, but pastries, etc. look very good & I'm guessing I will not be disappointed.

kMsayTXzIjx60nS59-lFSQ.text: My hubbie brought me a baguette with goat cheese, sun blushed tomatoes, lettuce , peppers, some balsamic and olive oil . It was amazing !! The baguette was so fresh and soft inside and then crisp on the outside ! The goat cheese was smooth and bold but not too strong ... Loads of cheese on the sandwich too! The sandwich had been waiting 3 hours for me too, but it was I didn't even notice any sogginess ! He also brought me a chocolate salted Carmel macron which was so delicious! Their a wee bit smaller then others I've had around town but the taste was so wonderfully rich that the size was perfect !  I can't wait to go here in person sometime and see what other goodies await me !

-9TFQfujcCHdOUvJRtkVMA.text: This cute little French bakery has some attractive window displays. That's what had us come in. Place was very crowded and cramped so we decided to quickly eat our treat in their outdoor seating in the light misting rain. The shop worker was friendly and patient with us while we decided what to eat. Definitely a nice sweet break, just wish it wasn't so cramped.

66UxiC3qVp97-251vWWQpw.text: Wonderful place for an afternoon snack after visiting Edinburgh Castle. The flan, fruit tart and macaroons were amazing. Pair it with a flat white, macchiato and cappuccino to finish it. The service is very high quality.

HRzreeD5cH_kwjJ4g2R0vw.text: Excellent French place! Affordable, great cappuccino and pastries. Kind of small but adds to the experience. Highly recommend it.

PFSAUIHtImuFQUmZOQ938Q.text: The best breakfast spot, so amazing and fresh! My fav in Edinburgh!!! Also the best flat white I have ever had!! Yummy!

i7tV2A-qddyTYtaxQ6hOFw.text: Intimate location right off of Grassmarket.  Delicious French food - very fresh and authentic! I had Croque Madame and it was exquisite, with a perfect proportion of cheese, ham, and some spices to make it special.  I also had orange blossom drinking chocolate, which was a delight for my taste buds.  The pastries also look quite good - I would definitely come back!

pNdREGHaIGHyllMsX1R0Rg.text: This was a perfect stop for breakfast before heading out on a tour. Great service and food. Truly loved the quiche and salad for breakfast. Pastries are tasty as well.

0GZkDYenRLVo43yXu2L4pA.text: Very nice little french place where the owner is actually french! The food was very good and the service excellent :)

fDi57NmXmgWZq-8EnucvvQ.text: wonderful breakfast (2 days in a row) - croissant with jam, and quiche Lorraine.   Very good cappuccino.  Small place, very pleasant .

P_AHdl5sPpIwGmkKO8jeOQ.text: We past this place numerous times not realizing it was more than pastries until today we popped in to check it out. We ordered the soup of the day carrot coriander that came with a basket of baguette and butter, and a chicken salad sandwich made with baguette. We were delighted with our food and the coffee (Union hand roasted) was superb. We now know the sandwich or soup alone would've been enough be itself. We ended up taking the remaining bread home for a late night snack. We will return!

YJxBrdrkxpSOHU7wWYZeDQ.text: A small, french cafe near along West Bow in Edinburgh. The employees all speak French which was charming. I live in southern France, and the young woman taking my order was happy to let me practice with her. The lighting is bright, and the cafe is quite cosy. However, there's not a lot of room so it's probably best for couples or small groups. The coffee was tasty, as was the pain au chocolat.

-xINKIbvLluZNe50KmTvkw.text: Really great French cafe with superb coffee and pastries and even French radio playing in the background. Also beautiful inside with exposed stone, real (clean!) timber floors and tables. Tres beau.

hjDCjz7I_rkkyA1sLy9gFQ.text: Great inexpensive French brunch spot. Service is nice. You can either sit down and order or go to the counter and order.

7Nub-gQRguPqBPFARNWmTg.text: A lovely little french cafe in the old town of Edinburgh. We had two parisien breakfeasts with cappuccino and milk coffee. The french baguette and croissants are great and a nice little detail is the cafe art on each cup of coffee.

AmL_AL11FCp5m72g7aGWTg.text: This tiny little bakery smelled so good it that it literally dragged me in from the street.  That particular feat takes some doing as the street is what my imagination tells me (an others say it's True) inspired JK Rowling's "Diagonalley".    Located in Edinburgh, fabulously fabulous Grassmarket...  let your taste buds be inspired by the lovely and delicious pastry treats.    alright?

8Z4OiWK41OcsHpNPW3BVxA.text: Best latte I had in Scotland. I finished it up and enjoyed watching the staff pull one amazing drink after another. On top of the quality drink, the latte art (which I appreciate, but not at the expense of the coffee) was great. I had to order a cortado before we left, just to enjoy it as well. Delicious, French pastries, quiches, etc.

V6kLCCT4Wg4D25oBk0fP3Q.text: The food was delicious. One day I had the ham & cheese croissant. On other days, I had the chocolate flan (twice ). The staff was very quick and easy to work with and the food was great.

7QjiZ425jEo3DaiLTSSnsg.text: Very french. All staff appear native french. Cakes delicious, lemon tart nice and tart, vanilla slice lovely. Coffee excellent. Small place.

photos.caption: Photo of La Barantine Victoria - Edinburgh, United Kingdom

itYD-Qo9GOXQVjG3Q4Q2ww.text: Lovely and cozy French cafe to grab a coffee/tea and pastry. Also a wonderful breakfast and lunch selection at great prices. The staff is very friendly and the food is excellent!

N8Zje45YE_HYUAnfu2ZXFg.text: Perfect little French Cafe!  I've been to La Barantine in Bruntsfield once ages ago - loved it but am rarely up that side of town.  My friend and I had just finished the Santa Run and thought we had earned ourselves a treat so I turned to Yelp to see what was nearby and was delighted with the suggestion of La Barantine near the Grassmarket.- we peeked in and saw that every one of the tables in the tiny seating area were taken.  A friendly couple saw us and indicated that there were two stools free at the window counter.  A bit wonky but we were cold and hungry so we nabbed them (luckily the friendly couple were nearly finished so we grabbed their table).    The waitress was re-assuredly French, friendly and efficient.  Within minutes we had the options explained and had placed our orders.  The Soup and baguettes combo was the perfect choice and a nice value.  Soup of the day was a thick, rich sweet potato and parsnip.  Very tasty and the crispy croutons on top were an added bonus.   The 'Savoie' baguette was EXCEPTIONAL.  The baguette was light, crispy on the outside, soft and airy inside.  Just the right amount of filling - every ingredient could be tasted - all in balance - all full of flavour. I can still taste it now.  It was so filling that we didn't have room for cakes - but they all looked gorgeous and I did try them in Bruntsfield so I can vouch that they do taste as good as they look.    La Barantine is perfect for collecting your baguettes and croissants, or sitting in for cakes and a hot bevvie or for breakfast or lunch (if you can grab a table).

photos.caption: Photo of La Barantine Victoria - Edinburgh, United Kingdom. Great soup and sandwich choices

APWskCWhSktvFOwwHAag6Q.text: Intimate, cute, authentic French cafe with really filling food. A little bit in the expensive side, but definitely worth it. I recommend the croque madame - so good! Didn't try the pastries but they look really good too so I'll be coming back for those at some point.

photos.caption: Photo of La Barantine Victoria - Edinburgh, United Kingdom. Croque madame

j8RqQKH3kJ06pI5sJKHc0w.text: My son and I stopped in and we had the quiche Lorraine and the pain au chocolat. We both thoroughly enjoyed the food & drinks. The staff were very polite and attentive. The food was delicious!!  We'll stop in again before we leave.

msldBj4rfF2ajkP6S0xfFw.text: Solid breakfast with a large cappuccino and bread jam and butter. The cappuccino had movie powder on top which was a little different. The bread was fine but would love if they had bread choices. Still very solid and tasty at a reasonable price of 6.2 of pounds.

photos.caption: Photo of La Barantine Victoria - Edinburgh, United Kingdom. Large cappuccino. It was very tasty with a nice presentation. The prefer is coca powder but it&#39;s light flavored.

xW6rFbwzU1aqHPxFbVCNxQ.text: Cute little place along busy Victoria street. I had a latte, My girl friend got the macchiato, and her hangry self also got the tatelete multifruit. The coffee and the quick snack was spectacular. The place is very nice and clean and the small seating outside makes a nice touch.

photos.caption: Photo of La Barantine Victoria - Edinburgh, United Kingdom

5lkODMeS8cqn36HkYB-dWQ.text: Popped in for a quick breakfast, ordered the fruit scone with butter and jam and the almond croissant. By far the best almond croissant I've ever had, as the filling was gooey and not difficult to eat. The scone was also perfect and both were plenty filling. Great little cafe!

oDPDoXH4TaEylqSTSArIOA.text: Nice and cosy place in the old town of Edinburgh. Had cappuccino with an almond croissant and the vanilla flan for brunch - delicious! Staff is lovely too, place is well worth a visit!

photos.caption: Photo of La Barantine Victoria - Edinburgh, United Kingdom

iLvJPnMDDzJgALGxMeWjzg.text: Such a cute cafe! The pastries were beautifully arranged near the window, and the staff were friendly. I ordered a ham, cheese, and pickles breakfast baguette to take away. While the baguette was too chewy for me, the rest of the ingredients tasted great together. The paper bag was also cute so that's another plus.

MSkCRubiC-2SaUqerJTm2A.text: This place is better than Angelina's in Paris. It was sooooooo good. I saw the pastries in the window as I was passing by and I couldn't resist. 3.45 for a tart. The macaroon on it was the best one I've had. The fruit was so good and the filling was delicious! I'd definitely recommend this place if you're looking for a treat!

photos.caption: Photo of La Barantine Victoria - Edinburgh, United Kingdom
Photo of La Barantine Victoria - Edinburgh, United Kingdom
Photo of La Barantine Victoria - Edinburgh, United Kingdom

g7yNkh5uOc2pWhUYA7n_yQ.text: If you love French food this is a must to visit . The food is authentic and outstanding. They make a fantastic cappuccino and Caffe mocha . I highly recommend the quiche lorraine or any of their sandwiches. Dont hesitate.. you wont be disappointed

Ko46Xpk9uXtCc57XWsRyNw.text: I loved this place! I went here during my solo trip through Scotland, and I loved the quaint, cozy feel of it. I had a fruit tart and a soy latte, both of which were delicious. The custard was especially phenomenal... it was not too sweet, and it complimented the tart of the fruits so well. It was also very flaky and buttery, YUM.   I sat in the far corner with my book and just enjoyed my treats. It was perfection.

WXBdLyxPp75oOQC3Wa07Gw.text: On my way to St Giles Cathedral from Grassmarket I spotted this little French coffee shop on West Bow. I walked passed it at first, but was drawn to it by the amazing Eifeltower of Macaroons displayed in their shop window. So I turned around. It's a very small coffee shop with about 6 tables. I ordered a Cafe Latte, 2 macaroons (salted caramel and pistachio) and a La Croque Monsieur. They are selling some amazing macaroons, tarts, french baguette , french bread and other french pastries (like Croissants). Did I mentioned that this place is French :-) The service was a bit stiff and the prices are not cheap as you are in "Town", but they do some offers as well, like a drink, a sandwich and a dessert for either 7.20 or 9.80. I really liked the Latte. They know how to do a proper coffee.

photos.caption: Photo of La Barantine Victoria - Edinburgh, United Kingdom. La Croque Monsier
Photo of La Barantine Victoria - Edinburgh, United Kingdom. Macaroon Eifeltower
Photo of La Barantine Victoria - Edinburgh, United Kingdom. Interior

bJFW5d2WKPMiiEL4sHMIXQ.text: They are very good with bakers products. I've been there meeting my clients in Edinburgh never been disappointed in my breakfast. I love espresso and cappuccino, and I love baked food ...so here you'll be fine !!

ycEv98C2EQedWJOSOWmwoA.text: After an hour and a half of walking around Royalmile this is a great pitstop for the family. Croissants and begets were delicious. Americana and the fresh cream, so amazing.

5TfDofoNvphntzjU-MOk8A.text: "Bonjour" was the greeting I got from the friendly man behind the counter when I walked in the door. I had just gazed at a tower of macarons in the window after walking down the hill from the Royal Mile on my way back to my car parked in the Grassmarket. Within a couple of minutes I realised that my "bonjour" was partly to do with the fact that very little English was spoken in the cafe... I had basically just stepped into Paris from Edinburgh.   The staff in La Barantine Victoria were really friendly. It had the feel of a family-owned business, which may actually be the case.   I had the La Basque sandwich. It was a fresh baguette with chicken, mayo, roasted peppers and salad. I couldn't resist putting it down. Even though it was a big sandwich, I wanted more just because it tasted so good. I decided to go with the lunch deal of a sandwich (or quiche), hot drink, and... wait for it... a macaron. I had a nice pot of English Assam Breakfast tea which was tasty and at a good strength. And then I went with a salted caramel macaron, which was divine.   It doesn't look like it from the outside, but there's actually seating inside, so grab a table and savour the goodness of La Brantine.   La Barantine Victoria is great and should be on your list of places to try, even if you're getting a baguette, quiche or macaron to take away.

photos.caption: Photo of La Barantine Victoria - Edinburgh, United Kingdom
Photo of La Barantine Victoria - Edinburgh, United Kingdom. English Assam Breakfast. I could be wrong but I think I taste a bit of honey... Nice
Photo of La Barantine Victoria - Edinburgh, United Kingdom. Salted caramel macaron

Lk5hOFCobZortEsXXyo7jg.text: Very good pastries and coffee. Cute little coffee shop in royal mile area. Very friendly staff.

7YXQOH-SycBvxqe_WaMs8Q.text: LBV is a perfect little french cafe tucked into Bow street. The kind of place where the clerk says, "Bonjour!" when you step in and then continues the conversation she was having with the waitress in French.   The pastries, appealingly placed in a window case to attract passersby, looked divine. But as we were feeling a bit more peckish, they were not for us. Instead we ordered two coffees and some of their heartier fare: a lentil soup and La Parisien sandwich. The soup was very good, warm, creamy, and hearty just as it should be, and came with a generous serving of 6-8 slices of baguette with pats of scottish butter. The sandwich was also very tasty, although perhaps less my speed, with the inclusion of egg.   Overall, lovely place, good ambiance, and can't wait to go back and try the remarkable looking pastries!

photos.caption: Photo of La Barantine Victoria - Edinburgh, United Kingdom. Our table spread: Butternut squash soup with bread, Americano, Mocha, and La Parisien sandwich (Ham, egg, and Comté)

Gms9N3i6uhPtRtRcM8O7dg.text: I think the worst thing I can say about this place is that they opened at 8:06 rather than 8am. The shop offers a nice selection of pastries, ornate cakes and slices, drinks, and sandwiches. As we were there for breakfast, we shared a raisin swirl, lemon meringue, and slice of apple tart, along with coffee and a refreshing peppermint tea. Each food was presented on small slate plates. Gorgeous and delicious.

photos.caption: Photo of La Barantine Victoria - Edinburgh, United Kingdom. our shared breakfast
Photo of La Barantine Victoria - Edinburgh, United Kingdom. pastries
Photo of La Barantine Victoria - Edinburgh, United Kingdom. pastries

OJpRbq5BxarUuu3gvT8yJA.text: Delicious baguette and oat milk latte! A great vegan snack I had in the middle of a walking tour. Friendly and cute cafe. I will definitely  be back here, I miss French food now that I've left Paris.

UHURqDoDNYGZ4PHdG4vntg.text: I honestly love this place. La Barantine Victoria is a quaint bakery that offers delicious pastries, heart-warming lattes (with BEAUTIFUL art), and good vibes only. I enjoyed it so much that I came here twice with my boyfriend and we were only in Edinburgh for two days (we probably would've came every day if we discovered it during our first day).   The vegetable quiche is amazing and comes with a healthy portioned side salad (note: salad apparently doesn't come with quiches when you do take away). Their cappuccino had some of the best art I've seen, and their croissants are to die for. I ordered both a chocolate and a regular croissant and was planning to save one for later but couldn't because they were that good...  Come here if you're visiting Edinburgh, you won't be disappointed! P.S. They do NOT have WiFi in case you were wondering (as of Oct. 2018).

photos.caption: Photo of La Barantine Victoria - Edinburgh, United Kingdom. View from the tables outside
Photo of La Barantine Victoria - Edinburgh, United Kingdom. Vegetable quiche and a cappuccino. Both beautifully presented and delicious
Photo of La Barantine Victoria - Edinburgh, United Kingdom. Cappuccino, absolutely gorgeous

5C116VbcEVa9DO9nOgxIfw.text: What a charming little French cafe in Edinburgh. The cafe culture in Edinburgh is something I haven't been able to find yet back home in D.C., and La Barantine Victoria adds a lot to the offerings that Edinburgh has.   The atmosphere is quite nice, combining the old stone look of Victoria Street with that French charm. I ordered a cappuccino and the Le Normand sandwich. The cappuccino was the best I'd had in Edinburgh (I'd had about 4 in my 5 days there). I also really loved the sandwich. It came on a baguette and was filled with butter, ham, brie, and salad. It's something I would have eaten on my many days in Belgium and it made me feel like I was back in my childhood, which was a great feeling.   I would recommend La Barantine Victoria if you're walking down Victoria Street looking for a place to grab a quick bite or a coffee. Their pastries and viennoiseries looked really good too!

_MzI1MXC2OnXS46txM3Hrg.text: French patisserie cafe close to Edinburgh castle.  Ordered a small hot chocolate, and a salmon cream cheese, tomato baguette. Crispy, savory, and paired very well, they offered a variety of other desserts from fruit tarts to French macarons; this place was a nice cozy pitstop to have a quick bite .  Definitely a nice place to dodge the rain and have coffee or tea.

photos.caption: Photo of La Barantine Victoria - Edinburgh, United Kingdom
Photo of La Barantine Victoria - Edinburgh, United Kingdom
Photo of La Barantine Victoria - Edinburgh, United Kingdom

HMs0UtUfCiK05s8czwgLLg.text: La Barantine is by far my favorite coffee shop I've ever been to, nicest employees, the best food and the best coffee. When I had holiday in Edinburgh we stayed at a hostel down the street and had breakfast here 5 days in a row, seriously if you go here you won't be disappointed. Make sure you take a second to try the pastries they're insane (;

photos.caption: Photo of La Barantine Victoria - Edinburgh, United Kingdom

8XEUntYjnceumwVrK08b9g.text: One of my favorite happy places I've discovered in the city. Everything about it is charming, the staff are very nice, service is delightful, and the atmosphere is cozy with lovely art. The pastries are not just gorgeous, but delicious, which is often not the case. What really keeps me coming back is the delicious coffee. The barista takes great care in delivering a beautiful decorated flat white, that tastes like heaven, the perfect combination of creamy and bitter. I come here most Saturdays whilst my child is at dance class, and it's my favorite relaxing time of my week. A fantastic cup of coffee, a baguette au beurre et a la confiture , and a good book. I will usually get a treat for the child after dance she adores their macarons and chocolate croissants. They are fresh, flakey, buttery goodness.

XMcI_StI9Fa42fd4ROdTnw.text: The food is amazing. I had one of the sandwiches and my wife had the quiche. We ended with flan and espresso. Couldn't have been better. It's quite small but the table empty rather quickly.

kUMwqobVU7HH5s87SsQ8-g.text: My friend and I, both USA natives, have been traveling these past several days in Europe and did an impromptu stop here. I'm not much of a coffee person, but ordered the Hazelnut Macchiato Latte with some pastries. My drink was creamy, flavorful, and a touch of sweet. It was delicious! One of the very best coffees I've had in Europe and that's coming from a picky drinker. Also, the staff are so kind and wonderful, and the shop is adorable. Would love to come again!

NPeVEGWgmbo_MMCno9tBvw.text: Cute little shop just off Grassmarket. Great sandwiches and coffee. I had a very ample flat white that was absolutely the best cup of coffee I have had out in some time and I'm pretty picky when it comes to coffee. I had a croissant with butter and jam that was nice too. My wife and daughter had sandwiches which they both enjoyed as well. Definitely worth stopping in for a bite if you are in the neighborhood.

05Jz8OJ1-kr8ICEjfKpErg.text: Wonderful find on Victoria Street! Friendly and cozy. We tried the Quiche Lorraine, Almond Croissant and Latte. All wonderfully delicious- the latte was a work of art! A good way to gear up for the museums.

photos.caption: Photo of La Barantine Victoria - Edinburgh, United Kingdom. My beautiful latte
Photo of La Barantine Victoria - Edinburgh, United Kingdom. Window display of pastries
Photo of La Barantine Victoria - Edinburgh, United Kingdom

0dBCiGlk1cs23Lkl6eNPfw.text: We loved this place on our visit to Edinburgh. Cute French bakery with great cappuccino. I had salmon sandwich and the food was so fresh and satisfying. At a great location too- right on Victoria street, the place that inspired Diagon Alley!

photos.caption: Photo of La Barantine Victoria - Edinburgh, United Kingdom. Salmon sandwich
Photo of La Barantine Victoria - Edinburgh, United Kingdom
Photo of La Barantine Victoria - Edinburgh, United Kingdom

4kfTPxwJdNYicOLIFwM07Q.text: Great chicken and cheese quiche, and the best mocha I have tasted in Europe in a huge mug! Small place on busy street. Very nice staff!

photos.caption: Photo of La Barantine Victoria - Edinburgh, United Kingdom
Photo of La Barantine Victoria - Edinburgh, United Kingdom
Photo of La Barantine Victoria - Edinburgh, United Kingdom

HB5X703Y1xzzwfmZ1D1qXQ.text: In a 6 day stay in Edinburgh, I came here 4 times. I would swing by to grab a baguette or sweet to take back to the apartment we rented.   Every time the food was flavorful and fresh and the service was lovely.

5nRlq0ljtM3Rvslv8OeDnA.text: La Barantine Victoria is an OK coffee shop; the venue is in a really nice setting, and the overall quality is better than a typical chain coffee place.  I came here for breakfast and ordered an eclair, which was acceptable, though nothing to write home about.  It was just short of being too dry, and didn't really taste like it was worth the 6 it cost me for that an espresso.  That price would have been fine if the quality had been better, but it was just too high for the quality I received.  Given the fact that the staff wasn't particularly friendly or welcoming, and I didn't go away with an overwhelming desire to return.  The girl working the counter really brightened up when a person who was apparently a regular came in, which made the lack of welcome I encountered that much more noticeable.  Bottom line: There are a number of places close by where the coffee and food are better, and you're likely to be greeted with a smile even if you're not a regular.

zoPuYERIhCb6hBT97K1l2A.text: Every time I entered this cafe I had the feeling as if I was suddenly finding myself in the streets of France, in one of those small cozy cafes full of tasty croissants and other bakery sweets. And the coffee here is just perfect. I adore the soft and slightly bitter taste of cappuccino which wakes me up instantly. Well, the owners did a great job with that place and i'm thankful to them. I think that everyone should come here at least once and feel this peaceful atmosphere.

ObUX8xFA_8Z7RITIg_hdSw.text: Charming cafe with outstanding croissants. Friendly staff and reasonable prices.. Indulge in the amazing French pastries

photos.caption: Photo of La Barantine Victoria - Edinburgh, United Kingdom
Photo of La Barantine Victoria - Edinburgh, United Kingdom. Croissants, cafe pastry extraordinary

pUuWBTos5qjrtlFeWjnSwg.text: Cozy French bakery with tasty drinks, delicious sandwiches, and inventive pastries.  On one of the most unique roads in old town.
